author: Noroeste/Redacción
title: Bobby Portis Jr. es sancionado 25 partidos por positivo en tramadol
text:
La NBA ha impuesto una sanción de 25 partidos al ala-pívot Bobby Portis Jr. de los Milwaukee Bucks tras dar positivo por tramadol, un analgésico prohibido.
Su agente, Mark Bartelstein, argumentó que Portis consumió el medicamento por error, creyendo que estaba tomando toradol, un antiinflamatorio permitido.
Este malentendido se debió a la similitud en los nombres de ambos fármacos, utilizados para tratar el dolor.
La suspensión, que lo mantendrá alejado de las canchas hasta el 8 de abril, representa una pérdida significativa para los Bucks, ya que Portis es un jugador clave en su rotación, promediando 13.7 puntos y 8.2 rebotes por partido. Además, la sanción le costará 2.85 millones de dólares en salario.
Con los Bucks en la lucha por mejorar su posición en la Conferencia Este, la ausencia de Portis podría ser un duro golpe para el equipo en este tramo final de la temporada.
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->drug related crimes

author: globo.com
title: Condenado a 22 anos por estuprar neta da esposa é preso em Mucajaí, no Sul de Roraima | Roraima | G1
text:
1 de 1 Acusado estuprou vítima dos 6 aos 9 anos de idade, informou a Polícia Civil — Foto: Polícia Civil/Divulgação Acusado estuprou vítima dos 6 aos 9 anos de idade, informou a Polícia Civil — Foto: Polícia Civil/Divulgação
Um homem, de 51 anos, condenado a 22 de prisão por estuprar a nesta da esposa, foi preso em Mucajaí nesta terça-feira (8). A vítima sofreu os abusdos durante quatro anos seguidos, quando tinha entre 6 e 9 anos de idade.
✅ Receba as notícias do g1 Roraima no WhatsApp
A menina era estuprada pelo acusado sempre que estava na casa da avó materna e em um sítio da família, na região do assentamento Tatajuba, no município do Cantá. O acusado convivia em união estável com a avó da criança havia mais de 13 anos.
Segundo a vítima, inúmeras vezes a violência ocorria ainda enquanto ela estava dormindo, e para que não revelasse os abusos sexuais, era constantemente ameaçada. "Por medo, a criança omitia os abusos. Além disso, o acusado lhe oferecia brinquedos para permitir os assédios", informou a Polícia Civil.
Em maio de 2020, quando a criança estava com 9 anos - por não suportar mais os abusos – confessou para a mãe que "precisava lhe contar uma coisa, que era muito séria e precisaria chamar a polícia". A mãe da criança registrou um boletim de ocorrência e denunciou o acusado. Ele processado e condenado pela Vara de Crimes Contra Vulneráveis a 22 anos, dois meses e cinco dias em regime fechado.
Ao ser localizado e preso, o homem foi encaminhado à sede da Delegacia de Mucajaí, onde teve o mandado de prisão formalizado. Na manhã desta quarta-feira (9), ele foi levado à audiência de custódia.
Leia outras notícias do estado no g1 Roraima .

author: News 12 Staff
title: New York state troopers and K-9s to help search for missing in Texas floods - NewsBreak
text: State police have deployed a team to Texas to assist with search efforts in flood-damaged Kerr County in Texas. Officials say four state troopers and three K-9s have been sent to the area, which was hit hard by last week's deadly flooding. More than 100 people have been confirmed dead, and over 150 are still believed to be missing. The New York team will remain in Texas for 14 days to support ongoing search operations.

author: Anonym
title: Obituary for Hans Hauder: Only seeing the good and always being patient - The Limited Times
text:
Status: 29.12.2023, 16:00 PM
By: Michaele Heske
CommentsPrint Share
Hans Hauder died at the age of 97. © Private
With a positive philosophy of life, Hans Hauder from Dorfen has turned 97 years old. Now he has passed away.
Dorfen – Hans Hauder has died at the age of 97. "He was a happy person, always content," says his widow Rosa Hauder, full of deep sorrow for her husband, with whom she had been connected since her early youth.
Until recently, Mr. and Mrs. Hauder were often seen strolling through Dorfen, regular walks along the Schäfflergasse were part of the daily program. Despite his advanced age, Hans Hauder did not want to rest. The former car master, who founded the Hauder driving school in 1956, has helped a good part of the people of Dorfen to get their driver's license. On 19 December, death unexpectedly slowed down the native of Dorfen. A few days after a fall in which he broke his tailbone, he died in hospital. "We didn't expect that, he was already on the road to recovery," says his wife.
In his free time, Hauder liked to ride his bicycle, and his wife Rosa was always at his side. Sometimes they even cycled all the way to Munich and back. The home-bound couple liked it best at home. "The garden was his great hobby," says Rosa Hauder. The Isen flows right past – his paradise. "I found the best hours in my home," she quotes her late husband.
Hans Hauder has a life full of work behind him. But also full of "massel", as he emphasized again and again. Although he went completely blind ten years ago, he never quarreled with his fate. "I could also be grumpy," he often said, "but then I'm grumpy and still blind." This describes his philosophy of life: to see only the good, to always be patient. It was important to him to live together peacefully, he didn't like arguments.
His heart was particularly attached to his wife Rosa, whom he saw almost every day at the age of 13 on his way to an apprenticeship at Opel Forster in front of the former Soafa, her parents' inn – he regularly waved to her and married her in 1952. "I've got a very good woman, my greatest luck," he said just over a year ago at the Iron Wedding. The loving father was just as attached to his daughter Sigrid Hubatius von Kottnow, his granddaughter Eva-Maria and the great-grandson Elias.
